column3:
I don't think there's any hurry to do this.

What happens after this change if a user provides `-onlynet=tor`, please don't tell me it's silently ignored?

@laanwj 
> What happens after this change if a user provides -onlynet=tor, please don't tell me it's silently ignored?

With this change, running `src/bitcoind --onlynet=tor` will abort at startup:

```
2019-05-17T07:05:08Z init message: Loading banlist...
2019-05-17T07:05:08Z Error: Unknown network specified in -onlynet: 'tor'
Error: Unknown network specified in -onlynet: 'tor'

FWIW the deprecation warning this PR would remove was added more recently with https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13532 than the 2014 commit https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/60dc8e4208 mentioned in the PR description above.

@jonatack Right. It seems like this was effectively deprecated in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/60dc8e4208 but users would only have known about it with https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13532. Closing, but perhaps we could add a release note item about the deprecation so more people know about it in case we decide to remove it in the future.
>      With this change, running src/bitcoind --onlynet=tor will abort at startup:\n\nThat's good at least.
nit: update this to be a variation on a valid network?
Not 100% sure what you mean. Like introduce a `NET_LEGACY`?
